Classes

class  AGApplication
 Base class for application - holds the main loop

Use AGApplication as base class your application's class. In this library it's assumed that you have different parts of your program, that are really different. Each of these parts has its own AGApplication. The actual control of these applications is done through a main-loop, that queries new events from libSDL and gives them to the correct widgets. This main-loop can by started by run(). After this your have some possibilities to access control. FOr instance there are the different event* functions, which you can override in an AGApplication's subclass. More...

void disableKeyrepeat (   ) 
 

AGApplication* getApplication (   ) 
 

getApplication returns the current active application. This gets set on each iteration of AGApplication::run. So it will be correct after finishing a frame, when you are using nested AGApplications.
